intro: Boucerosia gussoneana, commonly known as the Gussone's boucerosia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, fleshy leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections.
